boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery – Badassasaurus Rex
boardgame.description:
BADASSASAURUS! This model is so big we have to include its own massive unique hex arena for it. This enemy that is the pinnacle of badassery it fills four hexes and is almost 6" tall when fully opened! In addition to the Badassasaurus model it includes Piston, a unique hex arena, printed scenarios and game cards.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery

boardgame.name: Elephant in the Room
boardgame.description:
Elephant in the Room is a fast paced party game for 4 to 8 players.

Each round two players take on the role of speakers and draw a card from the deck. They must have have a conversation about the secret topic on the card while the other players listen in and attempt to guess the key words!

The other players try to guess the topic and if they get it right and they score the card and are the speaker next round! Guess wrong and they have to wait for another player to make a guess before they can try again!

Score enough elephants on your cards to win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: PizzaPorazzi!
boardgame.description:
The New Card Game to Create, Pizzas, Together.

Place 4 Pizza Cards on the Table.
Deal 5 Ingredients Cards to each Player.
Starting from the youngest player,
proceed clockwise.

On your turn, you must place at least one Ingredient close to a Pizza Card which contains it.
When you complete one or more Pizza Cards, just take them.

At the end of your turn, replace a total of 4 Pizza Cards on the Table and 5 Ingredients in your hand.

When all the PizzaCards are completed, who scored the highest number of Points...
Is the Winner!

—description from the publisher

Official PizzaPorazzi! Page with Pics and more descriptions:
http://www.warangel.it/PizzaEng.htm

boardgame.name: Dome
boardgame.description:
A cataclysm wiped out part of the global population and compelled all survivors to live hidden due to the harsh weather.

You are one of them and you heard some rumors about a dome build somewhere in the East. A place where you'll be able to start all over again and try to plant the seed for a new society.

Dome is a surviving deckbuilding game for 1 to 4 players in which every action you'll take will be critical. Your journey to Dome will be tough, whereas you'll try to find food, parrain new members for your crew or barter items for your survival.

Each player starts with the same deck. At your turn, you will play ALL your hand :

"Exploration" to reach Dome or send explorer to quest,
"Food" to cook skewered frogs,
"People" to use their special skill if you feed them, otherwise they will starve to death...
"Hope" to convince people to join your team or barter items.


When a player reach Dome or when three piles of cards are empty, the last turn occurs. The player with the most Influence Points on all the cards they acquired during the game wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Balaclava: Breaking the siege 25 October 1854
boardgame.description: Hex and counter minigame. Uses the Musket and Saber Quickplay system to portray the major battle of the Crimean War. Combat is based on unit quality rather than numbers. Special rules cover the Allied redoubts.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Musket & Saber Combat System (Decision Games)

boardgame.name: Unsere Nationale Volksarmee im Manöver
boardgame.description:
Each player has 9 infantry units (Gruppe), 3 tanks (Panzer), 3 Anti-tank guns (PAK) and 3 grenade launchers (Werfer), wich are set up on opposite sides of the game board on the corresponding spaces. Movement is figure per turn. The pieces have different movement capabilities and shooting ranges. Some spaces cause terrain modifications.

A piece eliminates an enemy piece if it gets near enough to place the enemy piece inside its shooting range. Exception: a grenade launcher can't hurt a tank.

The goal of the game is to eliminate al enemy pieces to win the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Red Dragon Inn: One Thousand Cranes Promo Card
boardgame.description:
SlugFest Games promo prize card for donation to Extra Life 2020!

Text on the card:

One Thousand Cranes
Prize
The next time you ante, add this card to the Prize Bin. You may reveal any number of Gambling and/or Cheating Cards from your hand. For each card you reveal in this way, gain 1 Fortitude.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew
The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl

boardgame.name: Red Dragon Inn: Water of Life Promo Card
boardgame.description:
SlugFest Games promo card for donatin to Extra Life 2019

Text on the card:

Water of Life
Drink Event
You may pay 2 Gold to the Inn. If you do, gain 2 Fortitude, then each other player pays 2 Gold to the Inn, then each other player gains 1 Fortitude.
A bit of Extra Life for everyone!
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew
The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl

boardgame.name: Nasty Little Nobbits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This scenario is set in the lands of Hylax the campaign created by the author for her T&T/M!M! players over the past few years.

A group of bandits called NO SMALL THREAT, whose hideout is in the Smuggly Wood north of Ballymoral, has managed to get through part of Blightus’ dungeon under Mt. Blight, and has stolen his Crown of Horrendous Evil. Blightus does not care so much about the crown as he does about his wounded pride. He wants the crown back, and the thieves punished. He will pay 1,000 pieces of actual gold and will grant a magical weapon to anyone who brings back the crown.

According to Blightus, the bandits of No Small Threat have their hideout in a small but multilevel cave complex in the Smuggly Wood north of Ballymoral. They are known as cunning opponents.

This adventure assumes characters have between 30-40 adds, and CON scores around 40 or better.

boardgame.name: Ozaka's Guide to Legions
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ozaka's Guide to Legions is a ‘zine-size guide to giants and war for 5e. Stride into battle head, shoulders, waist, and possibly knees above the rest with new playable giants, from ogres and trolls up to the mighty fire, frost, and storm giants! These mighty juggernauts have incredible size and strength but only two magic item slots, and can attune one of them to their own giant nature to unlock elemental powers like the storm giant’s control of the weather or a fire giant’s mastery of flame.

Lead armies into battle with the new system for strategic combat, more massive than mass battles, allowing you to lead multiple armies in a fight across several different fronts. The strategic combat system allows you to resolve combats you are not present at within just a few minutes, meaning you can have battles raging all across a massive frontline without having to play out each individual battle as a mass combat, nor get the PCs involved directly with each individual confrontation. Ozaka’s Guide does come with a quick and easy mass combat system for completeness’ sake, but it’s also compatible with whatever mass combat system you’re already using.

Being reduced to 0 HP is threatening like never before with the new injury system, a 3d6 table of injuries ranging from mild bruising to decapitation rolled every time you hit 0 HP. If you’re lucky, you may end up popping back up to half HP immediately with nothing more than an exhaustion level and maybe a one-round stun worse for wear, but if you’re unlucky you might end up critically wounded and needing multiple long rests to heal. It’s not all bad news, though. While at 0 HP, you can still take an action to give your surviving teammates a bit of good luck, giving them temporary HP, inspiration, or some extra damage. These buffs are less useful than the actions you might take if you were still on your feet, but it gives you something to do while you’re down besides wraith in agony.

And there’s more! New bosses and mooks! Advice on how to design your own action-oriented bosses with cinematic abilities! New weapons and some optional rules for armor! All found in Ozaka’s Guide to Legions!

boardgame.name: Planar Compass Player's Booklet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Collects the classes, rules for psionics, and psionic powers from Planar Compass Issue 1 providing players with a spoiler free reference book.


4 New Old-School Essentials Classes
Rules for Psionics
Over 40 Psionic Powers

boardgame.name: Clement Sector Third Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Clement Sector!

In 2210, scientists discovered a wormhole allowing travel to the opposite side of the Milky Way galaxy. Once across, exploration teams discovered worlds far more suited to human habitation than those in star systems nearer to Earth. Were they terraformed by some unknown race? Are they just a coincidence in the vast diversity of the universe?

Over the ensuing years humans left Earth and began to colonize these worlds. Nation-backed colonies. Corporate colonies. People who simply no longer felt compelled to remain on Earth. The best and brightest.

In 2331, the unthinkable happened. The wormhole collapsed leaving those in Clement Sector cut off from Earth. Now these new worlds and new civilizations must stand on their own.

The year is 2342. Adventure awaits!

Clement Sector Third Edition is the ultimate version of one of the fastest growing space opera games out there. Powered by the Cepheus Engine, this book contains everything you need to run a Clement Sector game. This new edition contains all of the setting information you need as well as an entire rules set.

Clement Sector contains a history of the sector and humanity's expansion in the sector. It has detailed maps showing all 16 subsectors of Clement Sector as well as subsectors from the nearby Ariel and Tranquility Sectors.

Clement Sector also details the Zimm Drive, the method of stellar travel in this setting, and showcases six commonly seen starships. Deckplans, art, and statistics are provided for the Rucker-class merchant ship, Luxury-class yacht, Trailblazer-class scout, Atlas-class freighter, Starlight-class merchant, and Farragut-class destroyer. This book also contains the detailed character generation for which Clement Sector is known as well as a handy NPC generator.

Clement Sector is also filled with campaign and adventure seeds to allow you and your players to jump straight into the action.

Welcome to the ultimate edition of Clement Sector! Adventure awaits you!

boardgame.name: Magma and Ice Trolls
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not technically trolls, magma and ice trolls are called such for the similarities in their appearances as well as their ability to regenerate. More generally, adventurers like to refer to them as "elemental trolls", though there are no records of such creatures existing with alignments toward electricity or acid.

This Monthly Monster provides all the lore, tactics, and stats you need to run it in your game, and provides an elemental take on the classic troll concept.

boardgame.name: Tendril Marauders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Though uncommon, every farmer has heard stories of the dreaded tendril marauders. Once they've been spotted, it's usually too late - the best a farmer can do is run. Tendril marauders are known to ravage crops and destroy entire communities in under an hour - and while they are weak to fire, they spread it everywhere, causing even more devastation.

Includes the lore and stats for the Tendril Marauders monster, along with a 1-page fully-prepped encounter and an illustrated monster handout.

boardgame.name: Alganor, the Yeti King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Settled on a mountaintop far from "civilized" lands, Alganor and his yeti are usually hostile to outsiders due to those outsiders' history of ill intent. However, after a trial or two, Alganor has been known to bestow free passage upon certain travelers.

This PDF contains the lore and stats needed to run Alganor in your game.

boardgame.name: Name The Thing
boardgame.description:
Have you ever said...

...that would be a GREAT name for a band? Have you ever put two words together from two shops next to each other to make a hilarious name or phrase? Well, Name The Thing might be the next party game for you to try!

Take turns reading prompts, judging names, and thinking up names to vie for the best names for things! Can you be the wittiest of your friends and name all the things?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Sunken City
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pulpy District of Underwater Adventures and Unleashed Powers

Many years ago, when the Mist was only starting to gather, some of the people who would one day found the City tried to harness the Mythos of the Mist itself, to bend it to their will. In essence, they wished to bend reality and have ultimate control over every aspect of mind and matter.

Instead, their plan was foiled by their enemies and they were banished from the greater Mist. These fallen Elders found themselves in an Enclave, almost completely separated from the Mist proper.

Pushed beyond the edge of the City, this land sank into anonymity deep beneath the waves, covered by an endless ocean above, on the farthest edge of the Mist, bordering the Age of Wonders, the realm of the Mythoi.

Now trapped within an environment of their own making, the Elders pulled into their bubble of reality the Mythos of the grandest submerged society, Atlantis, turning their private world into a paradise, protected from the world above by a dome made of the Mist itself.

Inside, there are no Gatekeepers, no restrictions, and all are allowed to explore their Mythos, to be free to express themselves… but in this, they’re sure to bring about their own downfall.

This is the Sunken City.

This standalone PDF (22 pages) describes a new district in the City setting for the City of Mist RPG: the awesome and awful underwater world of the Sunken City. Here are some examples of how to use the included locations, NPCs, and Dangers:

Finally, unleash your powers: Mist? What Mist? In the Sunken City, your Mythos bursts through with all of its beautiful colors and terrible consequences. There’s no better place to feel like a superhero with great powers, no responsibilities, and lots of drama.
Answer any Mystery: Whatever burning question you have about yourself, your Mythos, or the City, the answer can be found in the Sunken City. You might need to infiltrate a crazed cult or search through an old collapsing temple, but the answer is there, within reach.
Bring about the End: Everything is possible in the Sunken City, and that is surely what will eventually cause its demise. Here you can discover rival factions vying for control over the future of the main dome of Atlantis, but the more power you wield, the faster you bring about the Downfall – your own, the Sunken City’s, or even the City at large.
Themes of pulp action and daring rescues: Running away from a rolling boulder, rescuing a kidnapped loved one from a mad scientist, jumping out of the window just before the tower collapses – these sort of things happen all the time in the Sunken City.

boardgame.name: Nights of Payne Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A complete story arc for City of Mist with ten legendary cases of crime and magic.

This City is going to hell. Here, ordinary people have the power of legends and no-one on the streets even knows. Everyone is hustling. Gods fight for their next paycheck while monsters control the drug trade. Why do we keep hurting ourselves? Do the stories inside us push us to kill? Or is it just our old wounds, buried out of sight and out of mind? The people who once tried to heal this City are now haunting it, drinking the misery of millions. All these wounded souls are stealing, backstabbing, killing, their pain glowing like neon in the night. That’s the way this City is. These are the Nights of Payne Town.

It is a time of turmoil in the City. The police are helpless against a new wave of crime, powered by forces they neither see nor understand. Ancient legends that were scheming in the shadows for decades are now finally enacting their insidious plans, raining chaos and suffering on the streets. The only ones who can stop this mayhem are nameless individuals, anti-heroes like your crew, caught in this mess unwillingly or all too willingly...

Behind it all lies a sordid truth and a malignant power that has been feeding on the misery of the City since its early days. But, even there, in the heart of darkness, there is hope... Can you find it?

What's in this book:

Nights of Payne Town is a story arc book, a collection of ten cases (adventures) that can be run individually or as an ongoing series (campaign), following the insidious operation of an all-powerful Avatar.

Each case contains everything you need to run a game of City of Mist, including a teaser for your players, the backstory, locations, clues, NPCs, Danger descriptions and maps.

Nights of Payne Town cases break down into three "veins", or sub-plots:

The Personal Vein, cases trailing the personal tragedy of the victims of a scheme to slowly and painfully destroy the very fabric of society in the City.
The Mystical Vein, cases following a magical arms race, where a mystery collector will stop at nothing to gather every form of magical object and being in the City.
The Criminal Vein, cases involving the rise of an unstoppable crime baron, a violent self-proclaimed monarch, and the struggle for power over the City streets.
At the culmination of the story arc, these three veins combine into a single super-plot.

Among the modern-day legends featured are Hansel & Gretel, the Wendigo, Goldilocks, the Snow Queen, a slew of characters from Arthurian legend, the Philosopher's Stone, King David, Paul Bunyan, spirits of Haitian Voodoo, and many more.

boardgame.name: Shadows & Showdowns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Shadows & Showdowns is an expansion for City of Mist which enhances the core rules and reveals much about the City and the powers behind the Mist - and beyond it.

Take your City of Mist characters to the next level and plunge into the secret world behind the veil of the Mist!

What's in this book:

Chapter 1: If Dreams Could Kill, provides players new options for character creation and development. Six new themebooks, 50 new veteran improvements, ranging from deeper Mist awareness and control to enhancing your character's Mythos abilities, 24 ready-to-use Relic and Familiar theme kits, and a concept guide for quick and easy character building, complete with character creation tables using Legendary Archetypes and Noir Tropes.

Chapter 2: Overlooked Attractions, explores 40 new City locations and intriguing locals to use on-the-fly in your campaign. It introduces some of the City's most prominent movers and shakers, best-kept secret hideouts, and the ‘who’s who’ of street-level information brokering, all designed for a specific narrative situation such as the crew seeking more information, recovering from a violent encounter, or requiring arbitration or mediation with an Avatar.

Chapter 3: Don’t Believe The Truth, reveals the council of Avatars that runs the City, their individual operations, Rifts in their service, and the details of their shadowy agreement to maintain the status quo in the City. This chapter includes 6 new Avatar profiles of the reigning members of 'the Truth' - Chairman Chow (Tanhā, the buddhist force of desire), Ganesha (Ganesha, the elephant-headed Indian god who is the Remover of Obstacles), District Attorney Barbara King (Shango, the Orisha of Power and Dominion), Dr. Talbot Leyland (Prometheus), Rosaline (Romeo & Juliet), and Monte Wolfe (The Boy Who Cried Wolf).

Chapter 4: Suits Unveiled, takes a deep dive into the Mist and its origins and into the secret organization behind it: the Gatekeepers. It offers an answer to the biggest question of them all - "What is the Mist?" - but mostly gives MCs the tools to create their own unique answers and backstories to the Gatekeeper organization and to the origins and nature of the Mist. Players will find complete rules for playing Gatekeeper characters or turning their Rift characters into Gatekeepers, including three new themebooks (Shrouding, Advanced Art, and Unit) and dozens of ready-to-use pick-and-play theme kits.

boardgame.name: Warcraft Manual of Monsters
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An assortment of monsters and races for your adventurers to face in the world of Azeroth.

boardgame.name: Warcraft Heroes Handbook
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Everything a player needs to create heroic characters for the world of Azeroth.

boardgame.name: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings – The Spires Abomination Expansion
boardgame.description:
Abominations loom several man heights over the head of even the tallest mortal. Their gore slicked limbs spider out from its bulbous, distended abdomen and thorax. They are instruments of pure mayhem on the battlefield, scuttling forwards and reaping a bloody toll with their scythe like appendages, leaving only bloody ruin behind them. Survivors speak of a keening whine, just on the verge of hearing that pervades their memories, a sound that registers deeper than the cries of their fallen comrades. This is the only sound an Abomination can make, the only sound it is allowed to make: a keening howl to convey the depth of their misery and torment.

Abominations were not originally intended to serve as organic war engines. They were an advanced and cruel form of punishment, devised on a whim by the Sovereign. Ensconced deep within an Abomination lies the body of an Exile who has betrayed his trust or breached the most sacrosanct of Spire laws. Despite significant effort, even the Sovereign's most ardent opponents have not been able to come up with a more cruel punishment and have adopted this cruel torture for their worst enemies.

Invasive cerebral procedures impairs the cognitive function of the condemned, as chemical and hormonal treatments are applied to make them lose control of their Life-Binding gifts and forcibly bond them to a lower organism. Multiple organisms were proposed and tried but the humble ant was ultimately preferred. While more gruesome examples could be made, it was found that those Abominations bonded to other species were too intractable or self-destructive. The ant's instinctive hierarchical physiology somehow makes it more susceptible to Pheromonic command, forcing the body to respond to orders while allowing compromised psyche trapped within the hellish amalgam only enough control to wail its anguish even while enacting the will of its tormentors.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Conquest: The Last Argument of Kings

boardgame.name: Harengon Harana
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A young harengon boy wants to use music to compete for the archfey’s attention. But he needs the perfect guitar to do so. Can you help build the ultimate instrument?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This adventure takes place in Maykanta, a Domain of Delight.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Strike a Pose
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Did you know gems can be exchanged for goods and services? Adventurers arrive in The Living Mine just as the archfey Mitali learns this, and she expects payback for all the gems she has given away.

A Two Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Nothing Ventured
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Adventures must work to track down a missing shopkeeper who has become trapped in her own shop, after a bargain with a powerful archfey has gone awry.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Karl Rising
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Four-Hour Season 11 Adventure for Tier 2 Characters. Optimized for APL 8.

In the Domain of Marocaro, a giant by the name of Karl has fallen asleep in a sacred grove. This is a usual occurrence, but he has started to have nightmares that have manifested in the grove. For some reason, Karl can’t be woken up and desperate fey creatures have traveled to the Material Plane to try and get help.

Included:

A multiple part module set in the Domain of Marocaro, taking you on a trip meeting multiple denizens of the domain
Detailed digital maps for VTT use
Printer Friendly version with pictures, maps and handouts in black & white


CONTENT WARNING: Gambling
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Amber Reclamation
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your investigations have led you to the peaks of Mount Ghakis, and the Amber Temple — an ancient resting place of terrible evil—lay before you. With any luck, the missing investigator is inside and their work complete. Unfortunately, luck doesn’t seem to have been working in their favor so far.

The seventh in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 5th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: possession, starvation (mention)

Reference the Mist Hunters’ Safety Kit article and Van Richten’s Guide to Ravenloft for tips and tools on running a safe and fun game.

boardgame.name: Unexpected Hospitality
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While you were attending to other matters, Alanik dispatched a team of operatives to Barovia. The team has gone silent, and Alanik fears the worst. You have been tasked with discovering the fate of the lost team and completing their mission. If you can avoid the attention of Count Strahd von Zarovich, all the better.

The sixth adventure in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 5th level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: gore, fur trade (mention)

Reference the Mist Hunters’ Safety Kit article and Van Richten’s Guide to Ravenloft for tips and tools on running a safe and fun game.

boardgame.name: The Last War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In this Epic event, the Lamannian Triune hurls the adventurers back in time on a mission to unlock the hidden secrets of the Oracle of War. In the blasted mud of the Cyran front line, the adventurers confront old enemies and new foes in a desperate mission to acquire the Oracle’s arcane codex before the rift pulls them back to the future! This four-hour Epic event is optimized for APL 20. Notes in the adventure allow for it to be used as a single-table event as well.

boardgame.name: Swords & Sewercery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Navigate the grime-encrusted skid row of Salo, a city of filth ruled by the iron-grip of the Cabal of Ravens. Then, scour the fetid sewers of their totalitarian dictatorship in search of the treasure of an affluent drunk, but beware the terrible poisons of the arachnohydra!

boardgame.name: A Bridge for a Rampage
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's a war! Orcs have invaded the underground caves and are preparing to raid the realm of men.

When an old acquaintance warns you that a detached squad of Orcs is advancing towards your village, you take up arms!

boardgame.name: Genotype: Add-on Pack with Collector's Edition Components
boardgame.description: Add-on pack for Genotype: A Mendelian Genetics Base Game with all components from the Collector's Edition of Genotype.

boardgame.name: Three Bridges
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 582nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features three rock bridges crossing a mist shrouded canyon.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Small Cave Complex
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 572nd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small complex of caves.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Cistern Cave Complex
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 573rd of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a small cave complex centered around a cistern with fresh water.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Tar Pit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 574th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a deep tar pit in a desolate landscape.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Hive Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 575th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features the entrance to a subterranean hive.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Giant's Crown
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 576th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a rock formation called the Giant's Crown.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Monuments of the Past
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 577th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a half buried monument of the past. The top of a pyramid barely rising above the sand still coverign the rest.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Wizard's Tower
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 578th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a remote wizard's tower on a small island surrounded by a water filled moat of sorts.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Energy Cubes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 579th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a alien metal pillars draining the life from the land to store it in energy cubes.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Nameless Graves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 580th of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features a number of nameless grave markers in the snowy wastes.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: The Dead in the Ice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This full color battlemap is the 581st of a series featuring various terrains. This installment of the battlemap series features skeletons frozen in place within an ice filled ditch.

The map is 28 x 30 squares in size, with each 1 inch square scaled to represent 5 feet. It is provided in 12 segments, which need to be assembled, in a single PDF using the letter format.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Sage (Issue 1 - Player Options for Old School RPGs)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dungeon Sage magazine is dedicated to serving the tabletop gaming community. This issue features 9 new playable races and 7 new playable character classes compatible with OSR, Labyrinth Lord, Castles and Crusades, and the 1st edition of the world’s oldest role-playing game. In addition to this, you will find new spells and magic items to keep your game night interesting.

boardgame.name: Penthouse X-Mas Party
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ho Ho Ho! 'Tis the season to be jolly. Even in a dystopia, street punks and corporates find time to celebrate the festivities. You are all invited to the `Penthouse Xmas Party´. No weapons allowed!

Animated and static Cyberpunk battlemap that features a holiday season party at a penthouse apartment. 7 map views included.

Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Feast of the Gobbler Witch
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Level 0 Holiday Adventure

“BURN THE WITCHES!”

A fanatical, starving colony is in turmoil and looking for someone to blame for their hardships! When the PCs are accused of causing the crops to fail, there becomes only one means to stay their death sentences: face the dangers of their savage island and recover the Holy Scythe of Mayflower stolen by the witch Abutit. If the PCs are successful, a ceremony of thanks will be served n their honor. If they fail, they will find themselves unwilling participants in the blood feast of the Gobbler Witch.

Includes a new, alternate character creation system using a single d4 to create your new PC.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find On a Magic Academy Student
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You really shouldn't be going through someone else's bag! What if we get caught?

This list features 100 items that might be found on a student in a magical academy/school setting. From general items such as a minute glass and a class pin, to more specific flavor items like a notebook with an unfinished short story about a school ghost or a heavily annotated book on planetary correspondences, you'll find it all here.

boardgame.name: 100 Treasures of the Elves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You know, they say the elves were masters of silverwork when men were still young.

This list features 100 mundane treasures inspired by classic fantasy elves. From a pair of gold ear cuffs in the shape of maple leaves, to a bronze statuette of a dryad peering from an oak tree, to a chevron shaped diadem with mother of pearl dogwood flowers, this list has it all. Whether the party has stumbled upon a hidden hoard or are enjoying rewards for a job well done, they'll find all they need here.

boardgame.name: 100 Foods From the Frozen North
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A sweet for the sweet?

This list features 100 foods perfect for a frozen north or Viking inspired setting. These detailed and delicious listings range from blood sausage with butter and lovage to Öländish frying pan bread to baked wolfish with mustard and dill. Also included is a handy glossery of terms which expalins the more unusual or archaic treats.

So, whether you're looking to give the party more options at an inn or describe the offerings at a feats, you'll find it all here!

boardgame.name: 100 Treasures of the Dwarves
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

That ring is dwarven make you know. You'll not find better.

This list features 100 mundane treasures inspired by classic fantasy dwarves. From a pair of copper ear cuffs set with tigers eye cabochons, to a pair of fine leather bracers engraved with stylized dragons, to a carved agate stamp seal depicting two crossed axes, this list has it all. Whether the party has stumbled upon a hidden hoard or are enjoying rewards for a job well done, they'll find all they need here.

boardgame.name: Gladiators
boardgame.description:
Now's your chance to compete against your favourite Gladiator, with this exciting new three dimensional, action-packed board game. This game enables you to recreate the Gladiators Arena in your very own home. With easy assembly instructions, each of the 7 events have been minituarised to recapture the spectacle, and of course glamour, that is The Gladiators!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 100 Frozen North Town Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

If we just press on we should be able to make Skalfjord by tomorrow.

This list features 100 fictional settlement names inspired by the naming conventions used in Viking era Scandinavia and beyond. Within you'll find names such as Thornvik, Hedeköping, and Kvenborg. Whether the party is looking for the perfect place to set up their base of operations or just trying to rest their heads for the evening, you'll find the perfect name in this list.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find On a Magic Academy Professor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You're telling me that you actually picked Professor Kilgrave's pocket? Are you out of your senses!

This list features 100 items that might be found on a professor or teacher in a magical academy/school setting. From general items such as a small bottle of iron filings and a spare quill, to more unique flavor items like a disciplinary note from another professor regarding a student or a confiscated trick wand that backfires on the user, you'll find it all here.

boardgame.name: Two Buck Town: Langvik
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Langvik, a thriving nordic style village tucked along the coast of a fertile river with the potential for prophecy, adventure, and dark rituals! What began as a single homestead has now grown in to a hearty village with a bustling market that attracts farmers and tradespeople from miles around. However, there may be more to this village than meets the eye. Rumors abound of strange lights coming from an ancient burial site, chilling rituals for prosperity and, worst of all, missing sheep!

boardgame.name: 100 Medievalesque Paintings, Portraits & Tapestries
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Who in the world would paint a thing like that??

This list features 100 paintings, portraits, tapestries, and woodcuttings inspired by medieval to early renaissance artworks. These detailed and interesting listings include things like a pocket painting of a violet colored eye with long lashes, a large tempera painting of skeletal death as a drummer, and encaustic painting of men riding a school of flying fish.

So, whether you're looking to fill the workshop of a great artist or add a little flare to your treasure hunting, you'll find it all here!

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find on a 1920s Law Enforcement Officer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You uh, you think he's got any ID on him?

In this publication you’ll find 100 different items that you might find on an American law enforcement officer in the 1920s, be they a prohi or a beat cop. Some items are fairly boring (driving gloves, pack of matches), while others tell a story (20 five dollar bills in a brown paper envelope, business card for a firearms dealer), but all of them let you know something about the person who was carrying them.

boardgame.name: 100 1920s Gangster Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Clicky Kemper? Maybe I know him, maybe I don't. Who's askin'?

In this publication you’ll find 100 different names for American gangsters or mobsters of the 1920s. Each name is inspired by the naming conventions of real gangsters such as Charles “Lucky” Luciano, Charles Arthur "Pretty Boy" Floyd, Alvin "Old Creepy" Karpis, and more.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find on a 1920s Gangster
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Let's see what's in his pockets. That might give us a clue to who he was.

In this publication you’ll find 100 different items that you might find on an American gangster or mobster in the 1920s Some items are fairly boring (driving gloves, subway tokens), while others tell a story (card for the front desk of a cheap hotel, newspaper clipping about a recent election), but all of them let you know something about the person who was carrying them. So, whether the party is trying to figure out the identity of a dead man or someone just happens to have rather light fingers, you'll be prepared with this list.

boardgame.name: 100 1920s Speakeasy Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Yeah, yeah, it's called the The Gold Dust Club. Real classy joint, you'll see.

This list features 100 fictional names for 1920's style speakeasies. Names range from standard club names such as The Jubilee Club, to references to "current" events such as Volstead's Friends, to innocuous sounding business fronts such as The Rainy Day Cafe. So, when the party starts looking for a place to cut loose in the era of the drys, you'll be prepared with this list.

boardgame.name: Victorian NPC Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Did you hear? Lady Swinburne is holding a ball this year. Imagine, her of all people!

If there’s one thing any game master always needs, it’s a spare cache of NPCs. Sometimes these can be as shallow as a name and occupation but sometimes you want to go a little deeper. That’s where this publication comes in.

boardgame.name: Wild West NPC Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hell Cat Kate Clement, at your service.

If there’s one thing any game master always needs, it’s a spare cache of NPCs. Sometimes these can be as shallow as a name and occupation but sometimes you want to go a little deeper. That’s where this publication comes in.

boardgame.name: 100 1980s Club Names
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Meet me at City of Gold, I have something to show you.

This list features 100 fictional club names in the style of some of the most famous clubs of the 1980s. Club names range from the massively mainstream like The Cabana Club to the awesomely alternative like De-Vne. Whether you're looking for the perfect homebase for your motley crew or need a cover for your local vampire clan you'll find the perfect name in this list.

boardgame.name: Tome of Tables: Modern School
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Please welcome the Laybrook Academy for the Arts class of 2020 to the stage!

With this supplement you'll be able to add detail and life to any modern, North American style, school your players may come across. Whether the party happens to be students at the local high school who spend their free time fighting the forces of darkness or they’re just scavengers in an apocalyptic scenario who are looking for supplies, you'll find everything you need here.

In this PDF you will find several lists of items which can be found in a modern school as well as several lists which will allow you to add a wealth of detail.

boardgame.name: 1920s NPC Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The name's Ira Fleming, and I think you're just the people I've been lookin' for.

If there’s one thing any game master always needs, it’s a spare cache of NPCs. Sometimes these can be as shallow as a name and occupation but sometimes you want to go a little deeper. That’s where this publication comes in.

boardgame.name: 1950s NPC Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tommy Gibson and I are gonna head down to the bowling alley, don't wait up!

If there’s one thing any game master always needs, it’s a spare cache of NPCs. Sometimes these can be as shallow as a name and occupation but sometimes you want to go a little deeper. That’s where this publication comes in.

boardgame.name: 100 Things to Find on Someone in the 1980s
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Let's see what's in his pockets. That might give us a clue to who he was.

This list features 100 items that might be found in the pockets or purse of someone in the 1980s. Some items are fairly boring (subway token, tube of mascara), while others tell a story (partially filled out credit card application, crosscountry bus ticket dated for the next day), but all of them let you know something about the person who was carrying them. So, whether the party is trying to figure out the identity of a dead man or someone just happens to have rather light fingers, you'll be prepared with this list.

boardgame.name: 1980s NPC Generator
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

There's a party at Michelle Chan's house tonight. It's gonna be, like, major.

If there’s one thing any game master always needs, it’s a spare cache of NPCs. Sometimes these can be as shallow as a name and occupation but sometimes you want to go a little deeper. That’s where this publication comes in.

boardgame.name: Mein Königreich für ein Pferd: Deluxe Spielertabelau
boardgame.description: A gameboard with sunken groves to house the fences

boardgame.name: Serpentine Hill Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Serpentine Hill Road

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes:

FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format (72dpi)

boardgame.name: Post-Apocalyptic School 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Post-Apocalyptic School 1
This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes:
FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format

boardgame.name: Far Plane Lair Turn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Far Plane Lair Turn

This is an .MP4 video battlemap compatible with any RPG game. The easiest way to use it is to play it on a TV laid flat on top of a low table - 40” TV would be the perfect fit for the gridded versions of my maps (but there's always gridless versions for other TV sizes). You can also use a projector or VTT like Roll20.

Includes:
FULL HD animated map in MP4 format (1920x1080px) with a 1inch square grid overlay (plus gridless version)
Still images of this map in JPG format

boardgame.name: River Canyon Caravan Road
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

River Canyon Caravan Road

Looking for a river caravan road, going through a canyon?

This cavernous crossing features a stone pillar reaching across a river. Stone steps emerge from the water below, while nearby trees loom tall over a dirt highway. The lagoon is surrounded by steep stone walls, and part of the road is covered by trickling water overflowing from the river.

With this map and its detailed, illustrated one-shot misadventure prompt featuring a hilarious incident with a kelpie, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Greenweave Burial Grounds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a lush overgrown crypt?

These burial grounds are filled with verdant greenery. The graveyard by the entrance is covered with wildflowers and lush grass, while the crypt itself is filled with more flowers and plants. Further inside the crypt are broken sarcophagi, a couple of prison cells filled with skeletons, and three glowing prismatic skulls. At it’s heart is the tomb of a king.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ruined Temple of the Sun
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a primitive, Aztec-inspired temple?

This ruined temple has sun-inspired etchings on the floor, strange yellow-tipped plants, glowing golden orbs and demonic statues. Intricate tiles are covered with rubble from crumbling walls, there are cells for prisoners, while sacrificial daggers wait on desks topped with ritual scrolls. There’s even a mess hall with hammocks, so the barbaric followers of this ancient religion can live in relative comfort.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Vault of The Great Dawn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a ruined temple with Aztec vibes?

This temple has sun-inspired etchings on the floor, strange yellow-tipped plants, prismatic glowing sculls and demonic statues. Intricate tiles are covered with rubble from crumbling walls, there are cells for prisoners, while cracked tombs wait abandoned. There’s even a mysterious vault at the end of the temple—what could be in it?

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ancient Clockwork Vault
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ancient Clockwork Vault

Looking for a cool clockwork temple?

This mechanical marvel has a mysterious vault right at the end, with a giant clock face embedded in the ground before it. Much of the temple has giant, ticking, rusty cogs, while walls are decorated with steampunk-esque lights. There are cells for prisoners, and bronze pipework with valves line the temple.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Undercity Smuggler's Sewer Base
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for the perfect location for illegal slave trading?

This sewer smuggling base has plenty of cells for victims, a vault for profits, administrative offices, sleeping quarters for hired goons, demonic statues, and of course creepy sewer frontage so the smugglers can feed unsellable slaves to crocodiles.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Undercity Sewer Chambers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for secret chambers to have a giant snake living under a University of Magic?

Ok, while that might be an oddly specific Harry Potter reference, these chambers are great for creepy happenings. There’re demonic statues, a mysterious vault, and cells for prisoners. There is also sewer water running beneath the whole dungeon, so if you did—perchance—want to add a giant basilisk living in the water beneath these chambers, you can easily do so!

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Desert Caravan Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a caravan camp in the desert?

This camp features an array of tents nestled against the cliff side, some hammocks that have been hung up in shallow caves, a fast-flowing “well” where a river emerges from the earth only to continue underground, and tethered horses. Nearby the desert is barren, populated only with shrubbery and large, rocky outcrops.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Forest Caravan Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a caravan camp in a lush forest?

This camp features an array of tents nestled against an overgrown cliff, some hammocks that have been hung up in shallow caves, a fast-flowing “well” where a river emerges from the earth only to continue underground. There are horses tethered to nearby trees, while thick forest looms high overhead.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Plains Caravan Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a caravan camp on a grassy plain?

This plains camp features an array of tents nestled against a grassy cliff, some hammocks that have been hung up in shallow caves, a fast-flowing “well” where a river emerges from the earth only to continue underground. There are horses tethered to nearby pickets, while short shrubs and rocky outcrops dot the horizon.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Winter Caravan Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a snowy caravan camp?

This camp is dusted with beautiful white snow, the trees and shrubbery gently frosted. An array of tents nestle against a cliff for warmth, while some hammocks have been hung by a fire in a shallow cave. Nearby, there is a fast-flowing “well” where a river emerges from the earth only to continue underground. There are horses tethered to nearby trees, and wagon wheel ruts are carved into the dirt road.

With this map and its detailed, illustrated one-shot adventure prompt featuring a cute winter wolf pup, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Paperbag Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Paperbag Dungeon is a tile-laying dungeon builder, with elements of "tower defense," hidden puzzles, and resource management.

Each turn you will choose a card to add to your dungeon. Build carefully because one wrong tunnel could let in monsters that have the ability to dig through walls, open doors and crash your Dungeon Gate.

boardgame.name: Expedition to the Crystal Caverns
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hydra Mega-Corporation has built a prototype "Hydra Drive" which can exceed previous records for high speed space travel. In order for this drive to work, however, a certain rare crystal is needed for fuel. So far this crystal has only been found on one world. That world is a hostile and formidable place. The travelers are offered a job collecting these crystals for substantial compensation.

boardgame.name: Further Horizons (#1 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description: Issue #1 includes expanded martial arts rules, monsters, advantages, magic items, NPCs and more.

boardgame.name: Transdimensional Adventures Core Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Transdimensional Adventures is a rules-medium RPG providing versatile character creation and advancement, using a d20+bonuses core mechanic. It contains rules for dimensional travel and adventuring across fantasy, futuristic, modern, alien and post-apocalyptic worlds.

The game includes:
⦁ 6 character Origins/world types (Modern, Dark Age, Exotic, Futuristic, Survivor, Traveller) with rules for creating characters of each world type, adventuring and hazards for each, and rules handling differences in skills and technology.
⦁ 15 Races each with their own special abilities, plus multiple variants and custom race-creation rules - play a human, demihuman, robot, mutant or crossbreed of two races.
⦁ Skills for multiple worlds/genres including 50+ classes/skill packages, and 30+ additional character Advantages; optional Disadvantage system.
⦁ Mutation system with 50+ mutations (major or minor) and 30+ mutation drawbacks. Random mutant generation or the option to choose from 10 common mutant types from the standard post-apocalyptic mutant or rare magical accident to the modern day superhero or futuristic character refitted to live on an alien world.
⦁ Spellcasting rules for wizards and priests, plus powers for psionic characters.
⦁ Magic item system including sample items and random treasure generation.
⦁ GM advice, world-building tables, bestiary, and treasure generation.

boardgame.name: Transdimensional Adventures Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Transdimensional Quick Start Rules are an introduction to the Transdimensional Adventures rules set, giving an extract of the core rules for use with the free Adventure Book. The quick start rules include sample spells and equipment, a 1-page super-compressed character creation system, character sheet, and 15 pregenerated example characters of various types - fantasy, modern, futuristic, and post-apocalyptic.

boardgame.name: Transdimensional Adventure Book
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Adventure Book contains a set of three adventures (one series of several interconnected adventures and two one-off games) for use with the Transdimensional Adventures rules system. It can be played using only the quick-start rules if desired, or used to run characters created with the full core rules.

boardgame.name: Goblin Errands
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Goblin Errands is a no-prep RPG for 2 to 5 goblins and one Tall Person. Together you'll go on comical (mis)adventures trying to complete seemingly mundane tasks as you struggle with a world not designed for you.

You've just joined a new family of goblins and you are determined to prove yourself useful. Clearly, the best way to do so is by running errands for the community: Buying vegetables at the market or procuring the services of a local wizard to get your wise leader unstuck from his chamber pot.

Unfortunately as a goblin you live in a world made for folk much bigger and stronger than you. And on top of that you have only a single Braincell to work with - and one that you have to share with your fellow goblins. Even otherwise ordinary everyday tasks turn into hilarious challenges.

boardgame.name: Red Planet
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Alien Colony battlemap featuring 6 different views. Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

Animated battlemap USS Abaddon, inspired by the ALIEN movie series. It features animated smoke, lighting and more! Features 3 corridors, Server Room Room and Medical Bay.
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, Television and more!

This bundle includes 5 map sections.
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, Television and more!

Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Hell of a Club
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Highway Ambush
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk High Ambush battlemap features 6 map sections: full highway ambush, close-ups, scrapyard area and more! It features animated lights, smoke, fire, etc.
Included are videofiles for Astral, TV´s and static files for Roll20 and similar.

boardgame.name: Fearful Symmetries
boardgame.description: With its companion volume, The Book of the New Jerusalem, Fearful Symmetries gives the Keeper guidelines for building an improvised campaign with dangers drawn from English folklore and Mythos abomination. Four systems of magic are described, along with locations, threats, tomes, and characters. Use Fearful Symmetries to flesh out the struggle between the lurking horror, and the shrivelled good intentions of those who think such power can be contained, and controlled, by mere mortals (Pelgrane Press website).

boardgame.name: Neon Avenue
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk Neon Avenue battlemap featuring lighting, smoke, rainand more effects. The bundle includes 3 sections of the avenue, a full view and a bonus alleyway with cargo truck section.

boardgame.name: Night Market
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk battlemap featuring a night market with a few local businesses and shops.
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Nightclub
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk Nightclub battlemap that features animated lighting, smoke and more! Areas included: Nightclub interior, parking lot and back alley.
Included are 4 video map sections of the Subway and 5 images for Roll20 and similar.

boardgame.name: Nomad Camp
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk Nomad Camp battlemap featuring lighting, fire, smoke and more effects. The bundle includes full view of the nomad camp, various close up views, a sandstorm version and a bonus spaceship crash site map! Included are videofiles for Astral, TV´s and static files for Roll20 and similar.

boardgame.name: Rainbow Alley
boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Satomi Penthouse
boardgame.description:

Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: The Book of the New Jerusalem
boardgame.description:
Within these covers are the never-before-published early writings of the author of the The Book of the Smoke. Sketches of English life, in his unique style, are interspersed with private letters and diary extracts to offer an extraordinary insight into the victim of England’s most notorious occult crime. These are not romantic yearnings for a golden age long gone, but a timely reminder that the terrors of our forefathers still linger on the fringe of modernity.

Written as the companion volume to Fearful Symmetries for Trail of Cthulhu, The Book of the New Jerusalem can be used as a Keeper’s resource as well as an in-game artefact for players in any Mythos game, and it stands alone as an entertaining guide to English folklore.

boardgame.name: Seaport
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk battlemap featuring a SEAPORT with boats, loading area, office buildings and more. It has 9 map sections!
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Sinful Aley
Sinful Alley
boardgame.description:
User summary:

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Subway
boardgame.description:

Animated Cyberpunk Subway that features animated escalators, lighting, smoke and more! Included are 6 video map sections of the Subway and 6 images for Roll20 and similar.

boardgame.name: Underground Lab
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk Underground Lab battlemap. It has 8 map different views.
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

Deep underground, far below the neon-lit streets lies a hidden corporate laboratory. It is here that vaccines are produced for many of the diseases and pandemics that affect the world.

The players are tasked with infiltrating the laboratory and recovering a rare vaccine source. The mission is time-sensitive as it will soon be transported in an armored vehicle across the city to the airport.

If they fail to recover the vaccine from the lab, they will have to try and hijack the armored vehicle before it reaches its final destination at the airport.

boardgame.name: Yabai Alley
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Animated Cyberpunk Yabai Alley battlemap that features animated lighting, smoke and more!

boardgame.name: Fantasy Island Temple
boardgame.description:
