boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

This bundle includes the static image files of our "Chinatown Animated Battlemap" bundle.
8 maps in total. There are 4 main sections and 4 alleys.

boardgame.name: Dice Forge: Twinples
boardgame.description:
Official resin figures from Dice Forge, approved by Libellud. These figures replace the 4 player tokens that came with the original game.

The figures are colored in blue, orange, black, and green. They are spray painted.

boardgame.name: Dice Forge: Dice Tray
boardgame.description:
Official Dice Tray for Dice forge.

The 2021 edition was offered to the winners (1st place) of some qualifying tournaments of the French Cup 2021 (Challenge of Gods).

boardgame.name: Kazuo Avenue
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

Cyberpunk battlemap featuring a long neon lit avenue. 6 shots included!

boardgame.name: Barbershop
Strohmann Jass
boardgame.description:
Barbershop (or Strohmann Jass) is a two player game based on the traditional game Coiffeur Jass.

From the rules:

Introduction
This is the third game in an ongoing exploration of Strawman Variations--developing two player versions of trick-taking games by adding strawmen (one or more piles of cards, usually with the top card exposed, that form part of a player’s hand).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture the most points. There is a small bonus for winning the last trick.

The Cards
A pack of 36 Swiss-suited cards is used consisting of A K O U B 9 8 7 6 in four suits (acorns, bells, flowers, and shields). If you only have a pack with French suits, you can use A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in clubs, diamonds, hearts, and spades.

The rank of the cards (and their point value) within each suit is, from highest to lowest:
Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Under(2), Banner(10), 9(0), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

However, when there is a trump suit, the rank (and point value) in that suit becomes:
Under(20), 9(14), Ace(11), King(4), Ober(3), Banner(10), 8(0), 7(0), 6(0).

With a bonus of 5 points for winning the last trick, there is a total of 157 points to capture each round.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Kuroku District
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A battle map in an electronic (online) format.

Publisher's blurb:

This huge bundle includes many different views of a Cyberpunk City district. It also includes the interior for a club and two small interiors of a take away business and a small gym.
Included are both animated and static for use with Roll20, Astral, etc.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Scott The Woz
boardgame.description:
Hey all, Scott here! Evade taxes like never before with the Scott The Woz edition of the classic board game MONOPOLY! Buy, sell and trade iconic locations from the series such as The Shaft Family Estate, The Litigation Station, and Stale Pretzels while using custom tokens of items on Scott’s desk! “Liquidate the company” and go for broke in MONOPOLY: Scott The Woz Edition!

The player pieces are a "The Internet and You" Tape, '08 Stack, Old Phone, Nostalgia Goggles, Party Hat, and a Tambourine.

Limited to 5000 units.

boardgame.name: Farewell to Chinatown
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The finale of Showdown in Chinatown
...
`Farewell to Chinatown´ is the finale to our `Showdown in Chinatown´ trilogy. It brings to a conclusion the brutal Triad war between Tseng Society and the Flaming Sword Society. The players will have to take over Triad businesses, survive a torture chamber, and assault a desert motel to finish off the Flaming Sword leader Yi Lok.
It is a system-agnostic RPG Adventure. The aim is to provide a readymade storyline, content and ideas for Game Masters. This will enable them to concentrate on running their game with minimal preparation. They can also add their own stats for enemies.
It includes a FREE Animated Battle map of a `Triad Torture Chamber´ (Static files included for Roll20). Check the trailer at the bottom of the page.

boardgame.name: Leuchtturm Ahoi!
boardgame.description:
Leuchtturm Ahoi! is a family game in which the players compete to build the most valuable lighthouse. Such a lighthouse consists of a base, a number of disks in two colors, and ideally also a roof.
On their turn, players roll five dice up to three times, setting aside the dice they want to use. By rolling simple combinations (a straight of three, doubles, triples and full houses), they can take lighthouse components from a supply, a straight of five lets them steal components from other players. After six turns, the round ends and players score their lighthouses. If colors alternate and there's a roof, they score most. Whoever has most points after three rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: A Letter from the Past
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Letter from the Past – A Vaesen Mystery begins with a mysterious package from the Society’s past and ends with the destruction of a village, unless the Society can restore order and right an old crime. The mystery begins at Castle Gyllencreutz and takes place in a small Swedish village far to the north.

The mystery introduces new facets of the Vaesen from the core rulebook and introduces new themes drawn from Scandinavian and European folklore. The mystery introduces two new upgrades to Castle Gyllencreutz, a new threat and a new tome.

boardgame.name: Tuque
boardgame.description:
From the rules:
Introduction
This is a reworking of a two-player Euchre variant that I was taught about 35 years ago in Arnprior, Ontario (a small town near Ottawa). It appears to have been a local variation on Six Hand Almonte Euchre (which seems a reasonable conclusion considering Almonte and Arnprior are roughly 30km apart).

Object
Seventeen tricks are played each hand; the object is to win at least nine of them.
The Cards
A pack of 39 cards is used consisting of A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in four suits (hearts, diamonds, clubs and spades) plus three distinct jokers (called Bennies).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Moosehead
boardgame.description:
Doppelkopf for Two

From the rules:

Object
Twenty-three tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture the most points. There are bonuses for catching your opponent’s Ace of trump and for winning the last trick with the Jack of Clubs.
The Cards
The 48 card deck is made from a double pack that has been shortened by removing cards below 9: so each of the four suits contain two each of A K Q J 10 9.

In most contracts, the cards rank, from high to low:

Trumps: ♥10, ♣Q, ♠Q, ♥Q, ♦Q, ♣J, ♠J, ♥J, ♦J, ♦A, ♦10, ♦K, ♦9 (26 cards)
Clubs: ♣A, ♣10, ♣K, ♣9
Spades: ♠A, ♠10, ♠K, ♠9
Hearts: ♥A, ♥K, ♥9

The cards have values:

A = 11 10 = 10 K = 4 Q = 3 J = 2

making a total of 240 card points. The basic object of the game is to take more than half of these card points in tricks. The card points are used to determine which team has won the round - they are not the same as game points which are written on the score-sheet as a result of winning or losing.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Nostalgix Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
Nostalgix is the culmination of decades of trading card game experience from industry veterans. By blending our favorite mechanics from the long history of classic card games and introducing several more unique to Nostalgix we have created a game that feels familiar yet fresh.

In our debut Base Set, a worldwide event has trapped anyone who falls asleep in a shared lucid world populated by characters from fictional universes humans have invented over the years. Join Heroes like Vix of the Six and Doctor Corvus and clash Fighters like the powerful Booster Box Dragon, Avengaline, and Gametron against each other to reclaim 10 portal counters, return these characters to their rightful homes and restore the multiverse!

boardgame.name: Grand Archive Trading Card Game: Dawn of Ashes Prelude
boardgame.description:
Grand Archive is an anime trading card game with western game design and extreme collectability. It is the first anime card game that embraces card interface clarity, low stat numbers, and easily understood rules text. Developed with passion by a team of anime lovers and card game enthusiasts!

Grand Archive is a game that is played between 2 or more players. Simply, the objective of the game is to win by defeating each opponent’s champion. Each player should provide their own deck to play. There will be information that players will need to track using some method implementing outside-of-game items such as dice or coins.

boardgame.name: D-Spirits Trading Card Game
boardgame.description:
D-Spirits is a fast paced Trading Card Game. It is designed to mitigate the luck you find in TCGs. The game feature 2 deck, allowing you to draw the type of card you really need at any given moment during the game.

Each of the 160 original spirits have game-bending effects that make each game different.

Taking inspiration from other "monster catcher" card games, players (or "D-Tectives" as they are called) take turn summoning "D-Spirits" to playing field. The D-Spirits can then attack on another or their opponent, to inflict damage.

Uniquely, each D-Spirit, has an SP value & when a player's D-Spirit is defeated, that player loses that much SP.
Each player starts with 5000 SP & the goal is to reduce your opponent's SP to 0.

boardgame.name: Mr Canoehead
boardgame.description:
The unholy hybrid of Euchre & Doppelkopf (for 2 players)
Mr. Canoehead, a quintessentially Canadian superhero: on a canoeing trip in Algonquin Park, he was hit by lightning while portaging his aluminum canoe, which became permanently welded to his head. As a crime fighter, he would capture criminals by turning around so that the canoe knocked them over.

Object
Sixteen tricks are played each hand; the object is to capture the most tricks. There are bonuses for catching your opponent’s Left Bower (dunking their donut) and for winning the last trick with the 7 of Trumps (the timbit).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Shiver: Role-playing Tales in the Strange & Unknown
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Experience tantalising tales of terror, mystery, and suspense as you play out your very own horror movie with your friends. See if you can survive the night in this wickedly fun tabletop role-playing game.


Easy and quick to learn rules which you can pick and play straight away!



Everything you need in one book to both play and host a game.



A Symbolic Dice System that avoids numbers, puts story first, and provides a variety of ways for your tales to evolve.



Investigate and explore strange worlds and stories pulling from popular culture and folklore. Flee iconic slashers, battle aliens, exorcise ghosts, and face any horrors you can imagine.



Play stories set Anytime, Anywhere, and as Anyone. From medieval peasants fighting zombies to 1980's kids on bikes, the choice is yours!

boardgame.name: Treasures of Lewdity
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Special items, weapons and armor.

boardgame.name: Additional Races
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bonus races.
...
This document adds new, optional races and half-races for Lewd Attack. It's entirely optional, and the new races might be more powerful than the standard races, or have other traits that may make the game easier, more difficult or just in general a different experience.

boardgame.name: Inner Kingdoms Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

All relevant creatures, monsters, and enemies for the starting area of Lewd Attack, as well as relevant Mind Break Tables.

boardgame.name: Realms of Lewdia
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An ERP game system.

Lewdia is a vast world where sex is magic. It’s filled with untamed wilderness, dangerous dungeons, and all manner of slutty monsters to vanquish.

boardgame.name: DIEX AÏE 2: Return of the Danes
boardgame.description:
DIEX AÏE 2 ("God helps" in Latin, the war cry of the Duke of Normandy - Pronounce "Dooss Ah-yeah") is set in England just before the battle of Hastings in the second half of the 11th Century. It depicts the numerous fights that Saxons fought initially against invaders from Scandinavia and the Continent to resist the "Norman Yoke". DIEX AÏE 2 includes a campaign game: It is used to generate tactical scenarios which are played on the standard maps of the series.
DIEX AÏE 2 is a companion game to the popular GUISCARD 2 game. Like this one, DIEX AÏE is a complete boxed game with counters, maps, rules, scenarios and play sheets.

This new version includes all the materials of the original game, but with counters printed on much thicker boards, new additional counters and map. New scenarios featuring the Danes are also provided.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Genesex Proposal
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Genesex presents the EROTICISM tone. It functions on top of the romance tone presented in the Genesys Core rulebook. This tone introduces the Sex Check as well as character options that enhance said roll.

boardgame.name: La Lettre de la FFJDR (No 1 - Apr 2000)
boardgame.description:
La Lettre de la Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: That's Bananas
boardgame.description:
That's Bananas is a bluffing party game for 3 to 8 players, where all but one bad apple in the bunch can share in the victory (must provide your own bad apples).

That's Bananas adds a fresh theme and a unique twist to the genre! Collect 4 identical fruit cards, or be unable to play when required, and you lose. Everyone else shares in the victory!

However, a player who calls a bluff correctly earns a Banana card. Banana cards can provide increasingly devastating disadvantages to the player of your choice. Use your Banana cards at the right time, and you can ensure a group victory (or a single loss, depending on how you want to look at it)!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bah Humbug: A Twelve Days of Christmas Bluffing Game
boardgame.description:
Mail your True Love one Christmas card each day—and be sure to boast to everyone else about it. In order to keep up with all the other suitors, you might have to lie about what you’ve sent. But lying is half the fun! Will you win by being the sneakiest liar, or by catching others in THEIR lies?

Bah! Humbug! is a bluffing and deduction card game that uses a special card deck based on the traditional "Twelve Days of Christmas" carol (12 x Drummers Drumming, 11 x Pipers Piping, etc.) plus a deck of 12 cards that form a circular wreath or calendar in the center of the table.

Each round, players are dealt a hand of Christmas cards. They then take turns secretly mailing 1 Christmas card to their True Love (playing a card face-down on the calendar). These cards are played in descending order, from 12 to 1. As each player boasts about what card they've sent, other players may shout, “Bah! Humbug!” to catch them in a lie. Lies that go unchallenged are awarded "coal" at the end of the round, while lies that are successfully caught earn the accuser 1 "holly berry" (or take away holly berries, if the accuser is wrong.)

A player can win Bah! Humbug! in either of two ways: by being the most successful liar (collecting the most coal tokens), or by being the best at catching other liars (collecting the most holly berries).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

boardgame.name: reMEmber
boardgame.description:
Friendship is green, and we are colorful? Yes!

In reMEmber, colors have to be assigned to words. Players should always connect their choice with a personal story. Everyone at the table tries to remember this story because in the end it's the WE that counts and what all players are able to remember together!

At the beginning of the game, all players receive a set of twelve different color cards. In each round, they assign a word to a color card and tell the group why they chose that color. At the end of the game, all players together try to recall everyone's colors and stories. For each color or story that's incorrect or not told, the team gets one minus point. Of course, no one is allowed to name their own color or story.

reMEmber is a new edition of Farben that is now played co-operatively and contains many new words.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: FYFE
boardgame.description:
The cover of FYFE shows a dreamy South Seas location with a blue sea, beach, and palm trees — but what will you find as you dig in the sand, and can you arrange your discoveries in ideal scoring combinations?

Each player has their own 5x5 grid, 7 lucky charm tiles, and 15 scoring boards. The game includes 125 tokens, with each token showing one of five colors, one of five symbols, and one of five numbers (1-5). The scoring boards show conditions that you must meet in order to earn the points listed on that board, e.g., the numbers 1-5 in sequence, tokens of the same color, tokens with different symbols, three tokens of one color and two tokens of another color, etc.

To start the game, draw two tokens from the bag and place them at the bottom of your playing board. Place one of these tokens in an empty space of your grid, then choose a scoring board and place it in the row, column, or (if appropriate) diagonal line in which that token was placed. On each subsequent turn, draw one token, place it on your game board, then choose one of your two tokens to place. If this newly placed token doesn't have a scoring board pointing at it, choose one of your unplaced scoring boards and place it in the row, column, or diagonal.

As soon as a line is filled with five tokens, if you have met the conditions on the scoring board for this line, flip it over to the side that shows points; if you are the first and only player to complete this scoring board this round, take the associated 3-point bonus tile. If you complete and score multiple lines on the same turn, take 5-20 bonus points depending on whether you scored two, three, or even four lines at once.

If someone drew a lucky charm token at the start of the round, they draw a replacement token, then all players can choose to use and discard one of their lucky charm tiles. These tiles allow you to exchange the tokens in your reserve, place a token on the board as a joker, swap an already fulfilled scoring board for another one, and so on. Each unused lucky charm tile is worth points at game's end. After 25 rounds, players tally their points for scoring boards, first tiles, lucky charm tiles, and bonuses to see who has the highest score.

boardgame.name: Finders Keepers
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurp:

The Hunt Is on

What’s more fun than a treasure hunt? When a man with Yakuza connections needs to recover an important family heirloom, he turns to the shadows for help, and runners will have to put some effort into following the item’s trail. It won’t be a simple job—when is it ever?—but runners have the chance to bound across Neo-Tokyo to make sure they find the needed object—and try to get it to end up in the right hands.

SRM 09-02 Finders Keepers is a Mission that can be used with both Shadowrun, Fifth Edition and Shadowrun, Sixth World.

boardgame.name: Framework
Framework: Egy keret a világ!
boardgame.description:
Framework consists of 60 "simple" and 60 "complex" tiles, with each players starting with 22 tokens. On a turn, the lead player draws and reveals a balanced assortment of simple and complex tiles, with one more tile than the number of players. Each player in turn selects a tile, with the lead player being forced to take the final tile.

When you take a tile, place it adjacent to at least one other tile in your display, then see whether you complete any tasks on your tiles; each time you do, cover that task with a token. Tiles contain 0-3 frames and 0-3 tasks, with each of these coming in four colors. A task might be, for example, a green 3, and to complete the task, the tile bearing this task must be part of a set of three tiles that have green frames, whether directly or via an orthogonal chain of connection with tiles that have green frames.
Tasks might be two colors, e.g., red and brown, which means that both frame colors can be used to satisfy the task. Alternatively, a task might be 4 yellow or 4 brown. Also, conditional tasks exist in which you must first complete one task before you can complete the second one.

Whoever first places all of their tokens wins. Framework also includes a solo game in which you attempt to place all of your tokens in an area of tiles that is as close to a 5x5 grid as possible.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieler Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 8+
Framework 120 Plättchen und 88 Spielsteine - viel mehr braucht es bei Framework nicht für ein abwechslungsreiches, abstraktes Spielerlebnis. In dem neuen Spiel von Uwe Rosenberg dreht sich alles um Rahmen in verschiedenen Farben. Diese müssen geschickt angelegt werden sodass Aufgaben, die in der Mitte der Plättchen aufgedruckt sind, erledigt werden. Wer zuerst alle eigenen Spielsteine einsetzen, also zuerst 22 Aufgaben erfüllen konnte, gewinnt das Spiel sofort.
Bei Framework ist nicht nur taktisches Vorausplanen gefragt, sondern auch um die Ecke denken, denn zur Erfüllung einer Aufgabe zählen nicht nur die direkten Nachbarrahmen, sondern alle Plättchen mit mindestens einem Rahmen der gleichen Farbe, die waagerecht und/oder senkrecht zueinander benachbart sind. Entscheidend ist außerdem, wer sich zum richtigen Moment die richtigen Plättchen aus der Mitte nimmt. Bei geschicktem Anlegen können so Kettenreaktionen ausgelöst werden, durch die gleich mehrere Aufgaben erledigt werden.
Inhalt: 120 Rahmenplättchen 88 Spielsteine 1 Übersichts-/Lagerkarte 1 Beutel 1 Spielanleitung
https://youtu.be/fr12fcNANQ4
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.description:
Ricochons is a cooperative game.

In each box there are 30 grids filled with words. For each grid, the goal is to complete a dialog by solving riddles through associating words and ideas in the right sequence. The words that remain left at the end of the grid will form a rebus that will help the players to complete an existing dialog.

Each grid can be solved separately, but the dialog to be completed continues from one grid to another and tells a story of funny detectives investigation (this is the theme).

All players work together in associating the words and solving the riddles. There is no restriction in communication and the game finishes when a grid is solved.

boardgame.name: Supermarket Sweep
boardgame.description:
It’s non-stop shop ‘til you drop with the all-new Supermarket Sweep game, based on America’s hit game show. Play at home with friends and family – this game is made for 3+ players. Play as a contestant or take charge as the host! Race to grab the priciest items you can find! This game features question categories from the TV show. Download the Gamestar App to scan your items using the FREE Supermarket Sweep Buzzer and Checkout Scanner. Answer questions to win time for your own Big Sweep where you’ll compete in a frantic free-for-all to find the most expensive items to fill your cart. The highest cart total gets to take on the $100,000 Super Sweep and be commemorated in the Aisle of Champions.

Includes: 1 scoreboard, 3 team answer boards, 1 host board, 20 game sheets, 1 host question category guide, 166 Big Sweep item cards, 100 Super Sweep cards, 20 shopping list cards, 6 inflatables cards, 4 dry-erase markers, 1 phone holder, 3 carts, 1 Aisle of Champions scoreboard, and rules.

boardgame.name: Pot Pourri
boardgame.description:
Gustav Germ, the famous gourmet critic, is whirling through the city and is once again distributing his coveted gourmet stars. He also visits the restaurant “Oily Oyster” – your chance to put your culinary skills to the test!
But there is a problem: To prepare delicious dishes, there are only three cooking pots available that you have to share with the competition. ... and there’s that annoying pot lid that’s always in the way and prevents you from completing a recipe. Anyone who, despite all the hurdles, prepares their dishes reasonably correctly and receives the most gourmet stars will be personally awarded the golden toque by Gustav Germ.

On your turn, take 1 out of 3 actions.
You can either

Draw 2 new ingredients, or
Draw 2 new recipes, or
Place 1 or 2 ingredients into a pot + move the pot lid!


Pots are placed in the middle of the table and are available for everyone. As soon as one pot is filled with ingredients (amount = 6), everyone has the chance to show one of their recipes and collect points. The more matching ingredients someone has, the more points they get.
Always keep an eye on the displayed menu! You can get even more points if you show the right type of recipe at the right moment.

The game ends after someone has served 6 meals. The player with the most points wins the game!

boardgame.name: Ducktail
boardgame.description:
Ducktail is a new game in the Schafkopf family, for 2 players.

Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the object is to capture 61+ points. There are bonuses for capturing 9s (especially the 9 of trumps); there are additional bonuses for winning the last trick with a 9.

A pack of 36 cards is used consisting of A K Q J 10 9 8 7 6 in four suits (hearts, diamonds, clubs and spades). 

Half of the pack (18 cards) is trumps. The face cards are promoted to be permanent top trumps (ranked in a specific order, by suit) with all the rest of the cards, in a named trump suit, ranking below them.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Dodgeball: World Tour – Heroes & Heels
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Dodgeball World Tour! This game is designed to create an experience akin to Vince Vaughn and Ben Stiller’s movie version of professional dodgeball, but presented as a touring road show, similar to professional wrestling. On the Dodgeball World Tour, an ever-evolving collection of teams travel from city to city, entertaining fans with a nightly program that features an escalating series of matches.

Put together your team, line up on the court, rush for the balls, roll dice to score hits on your opponents and the team with the last player standing wins. Advance on the tour, improve your TV ratings and become the Dodgeball World Tour champion.

boardgame.name: Copyright
boardgame.description:
Use 36 cards ranking AKQJT9876 in each suit, plus 3 Jokers distinguished as Red, Black, and White. Deal 13 cards each in ones.

The objective is to win tricks and enable your right-hand neighbour to win more than the player on your left. The player with the greatest number of tricks that matches these conditions, wins.

Dealer's left-hand neighbour leads to the first trick. You must follow suit if you can, but may otherwise play any card. The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led, or by the highest trump if any are played, and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

You score the number of tricks you won multiplied by the number won by your right-hand neighbour.

boardgame.name: Crescendo
boardgame.description:
Deal 52 cards (or 36 if three play. For 2 players, see below) ranking AKQJT9876(5432). Deal them all out in ones. If five play, discard the odd two.

The objective is to win tricks of higher rather than lower value. The player with the highest number of points, wins.

Dealer's left-hand neighbour leads to the first trick. You must follow suit if you can, but may otherwise play any card. The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

Each trick is worth a different value, with values ascending, then dropping in value, then ascending again over the course of 10-13 tricks (depending on player count).

boardgame.name: Dividend
boardgame.description:
At first sight Dividend looks and plays like an ordinary four-player trick-taking game. The difference is that when you win a trick you don’t necessarily win all four of its constituent cards – you may, instead, win three, two or only one of them, depending on your position at the beginning of the trick. Thus at the end of a round of 13 tricks you score not for how many tricks but for how many cards you won, which could be anything from under 7 to over 20.
Four can play either solo or, if preferred, in two partnerships, with partners sitting opposite each other and playing alternately to each trick.

boardgame.name: Trash Pals
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Trash Pals is a light-hearted tabletop RPG where players work together as a group of animal friends looking for the best trash haul of their lives! Play as a raccoon, an opossum, a stray cat or an urban fox as you sniff out only the best half-empty takeout containers and cheese wrappers that humans can throw away, and work together to mitigate barriers between you and your ultimate haul. You only have one night!

Trash Pals uses the Caltrop Core system by Titanomachy. All you need to play are these rules, a piece of paper and writing utensil, and some four sided dice!

boardgame.name: Same Difference
boardgame.description:
Object
To win tricks, especially by playing two cards with the greatest possible difference between them. For this purpose cards have numerical values from Ace = 1 up to King=13. Thus if the cards you play are King-Ace the difference between them is 12 (=13-1), while if they are equal the difference is zero.

Each trick must contain exactly one card of each suit.

boardgame.name: The Caltrop Core SRD
boardgame.description: The Caltrop Core is a system with simple mechanical tools that anyone can build on to make their first game.

boardgame.name: アングレット (unGret)
boardgame.description:
アングレット (unGret) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The publisher calls it 'psychological warfare' and 'mind-reading'. Each player has four cards numbered 1 to 4 and some markers. The players choose only card to go face-down. They must deduce which of their opponents cards is face-down and can spend markers to expose remaining hand cards. The game is balanced by the cost of markers against the chance of success.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Tribal Designer GAI (トライバルデザイナーGAI)

boardgame.name: You Be Aim (ユビエイム)
boardgame.description:
ユビエイム (You Be Aim) is a 2 player flicking game from Japan. The publisher Protocraft focuses on games with miniatures of mechas (brutalist robots). Players have a crawling mecha each, and must move around the factory to achieve goals. The mecha has a hollow body and the player loads a cylinder into the mecha and then fires it across the board by flicking the back of the mecha.

The game board in You Be Aim is double-sided, so players can play two different games. In one game, Watari Usagi (わたりうさぎ), they aim to fire cylinders at the rabbit robots of their opponent. In the other game, Jitsuriki Sugoroku (実力すごろく), the players must move around the factory and fire at targets on the walls without hitting the rabbit robots.

Customers who reserved early for the game at the Tokyo Game Market got a free metal miniature rabbit robot.
user summary

boardgame.name: Widderkopf
boardgame.description:
A Sheepshead-like game for 2 players.

Seventeen tricks are played each hand; certain cards are worth certain points; the main object of the hand is to capture 61+ points.

With Cracking, Recracking, Schneidering, and Schwartzing, the game value can progress from as low as a single measly point for an entire hand of play, or as much as 64(!) points for the same hand (if both players are doubling fools).
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: Old MacDonald
boardgame.description:
This game is based on Phat, a Scottish member of the All Fours family (whose members include Pitch, Pedro, and Don).

Twenty-one tricks are played each hand; the object is to peg points on a Cribbage board for capturing valuable cards. The game end is triggered when someone pegs 180 (or more) points. The hand is completed and the player with the higher score wins.

The game is quite simple to teach as it uses standard must-follow trick-taking. To increase balance, one player will pick a trump suit and the other player will pick the rank order (which cards are high or low). What elevates the game is its distribution of card points among the ranks; in particular, trying to avoid giving up the high Phat points for capturing the middle-ranking 9s makes for some interesting and sometimes quite tense decisions.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: The Game Artisans of Canada

boardgame.name: The Dragon's Hoard (Issue #13 - Dec 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magic, Monsters, and More!
The Dragon’s Hoard is a monthly anthology of magic items, spells, monsters, and more for your 5th Edition campaign! Each issue of The Dragon’s Hoard takes every new magic item, spell, monster, or other new rules content from our ongoing Legendary Loot Patreon and presents it for you, with dozens of new elements beautifully illustrated and ready to unleash on your players! In this month's features you'll find:
• The Treasure Trove, featuring magnificent magical and technological items like the nullblade, arc rifle, skystrider harness, and dwarf star grenade!
• Basker’s Books, featuring new spells for almost every 5E spellcaster like flicker, antitech field, mundane paradigm, and remove radioactivity!
• Class Acts, featuring new class options for your 5E heroes like the new bombardier and nanotech infuser!
• Marvelous Monsters, featuring killer creatures across every challenge level like the heavy metal elemental, the destructive vexgit gremlin, and the fearsome clockwork leviathan!

boardgame.name: Artisan
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Artisan class for the Low Fantasy Gaming system.

"You are an Artisan, a humble craftsman dedicated to perfecting their trade. You may be a blacksmith that specializes in metal armor and weapons, a woodsman that has a penchant for leatherworking and fletching, or a culinarian interested in creating delectable meals. However, regardless of your craft, you utilize your unique knowledge to aid allies, weaken foes, and bolster your own abilities."

boardgame.name: Cloaca in Cathoway
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A lost pet (Ferret) goes into the sewer grate and the child's mother offers your group a reward to retrieve it. First day in Cathoway and you're already getting jobs. You may get a little dirty but the reward and potential reputation may pay off exponentially!

The scenario was designed for a quartet of first level PCs. This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch. The series features a rotating cast for a two hour game every week.

boardgame.name: Roseate Growth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

CONTENT WARNING: addictive drugs, an anti-labor massacre, mild body horror.

A labor dispute at a valuable mine reveals the horrors that preceded it. The fossils of a little-understood ancient plant, glowing the color of a dragon's fruit, are crushed to a fine powder and diluted into a rare, luxurious, and intoxicating spice with unknown consequences. A monastery of a small but influential religious order harbors a dark secret. A hapless group of adventurers will face the potentially far-reaching implications of these intersecting arcs and decide what will remain hidden and the shape of the conflict to come.

ROSEATE GROWTH is a fantasy roleplaying adventure for three-to-five lower-level players, written in a system-neutral style. It should last roughly two or three sessions with some ripple effects that could be tied into your broader campaign or ignored.

The book is 35 pages long, and it contains:


6 adventure hooks
30+ adventure repercussions
Dungeon map with 23 rooms
5 unique monsters
6+ unique items

boardgame.name: Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Legends of the Sand
boardgame.description:
Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Legends of the Sand is an exclusive expansion that was included with every pledge and won't be offered at retail.

Contents:

Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Mythical Monsters

6 Mythical Monsters tiles
30 Treasure Chest tokens


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Perils of the Desert

5 Deadland tiles
4 Portal tiles
6 Mountain tiles


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Hero of the People

1 Tavern board
4 Tavern Adventure tiles
12 Theme tiles


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: The Grand Bastions

12 Bastion tiles


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Lost Treasures

12 Treasure Map tiles
12 Magical Object tiles


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: The Queen's Favour

10 Favour tiles


Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Mysterious Ruins

at least 2 Mysterious Ruin tiles

boardgame.name: Asedio de Baler 1898
Siege of Baler 1898
boardgame.description:
"Asedio de Baler 1898: El fin de un imperio" is a wargame based on the siege that took place in Baler (Luzon Island, Philippine Islands) between 1898 and 1899. For a period of 337 days (almost one year), the Spanish were sieged by the Katipunan forces (Philippine Revolution). This heroic event would be remembered by both Philippines and Spanish for ages.

In this game you can choose playing with the Katipunan or Spain. It offers a competitive 2-player mode and a solitaire mode where you could choose between both forces. Both forces are asymmetrical, and the main mechanic is a hybrid between the deck construction and action points.

The game is played during 12 rounds maximum (equivalent to 1 month approximately), of 2 impulses o turns each round (one per player). At the beginning of each round an event might take place, it will be indicated in an event card.

The goal for the Katipunan is to break into the church where the Spanish were sieged or construct a system of trenches forming a ring around the church forcing the Spanish to surrender.

The goal for the Spanish is to maintain the Spanish position in Baler at all cost and resist till the end of round 12. Or succeeding in sending an expedition to Manila with the scope of find out about the real news and current situation since the Spanish were isolated totally.

In each impulse or turns the players will play a card to determine initiative. The first player will make all his impulse sequence and then the other.

Player will proceed to play cards in hand trying to be as much efficient as possible. These cards can be played to activate or plan different actions. After actions are carried out the strategy phase begins. You can use the points from the cards played for getting new cards to improve your deck, spend those points to perform actions as action points or a combination of both. Finally, all cards are discarded, and the player draw new cards to form a new hand for next round.

Once both players have finished playing theirs impulse the round is over and the maintenance phase will take place before starting a new round.

-description from designer

Welcome to the gritty, retro-future universe of HOSTILE which now expands with its own, dedicated rulebook. Based on the Cepheus Engine, these Rules add in the realistic combat rules from Zozer Games’ popular Modern War game, as well as setting-specific rules from some of the eighteen HOSTILE supplements. When combined with its companion book, the HOSTILE Setting, you will have a complete, stand-alone, retro-future sci-fi game.
HOSTILE is a gritty, near future roleplaying setting that is inspired by movies like Outland, Bladerunner and Alien. It is a universe of mining installations, harsh moons, industrial facilities, hostile planets and brutal, utilitarian spacecraft.

Comprehensive task resolution mechanics
An expanded character creation system, with a non-random character design option

boardgame.name: Fix
boardgame.description: Players are given dice with symbols and minus or plus points. The dice are rolled simultaneously. Whoever rolls a red emoji may place it in the center of the game (if there are not already 3). A die with a green emoji must be passed on to the next player. A round is over when there are 3 red emojis in the center. Then each player counts his current plus or minus points and gets paid chips accordingly. Otherwise, the players continue to roll the dice. Whoever has collected the most plus points after 7 rounds wins the game.

boardgame.name: Bimbo ist entlaufen
boardgame.description:
Bimbo the monkey starts on a black space on one narrow side of the game board. The two keepers start on two black spaces on the opposite side. The monkey moves diagonally forward or backward. The Keepers may only move diagonally forward.

To win the game, the monkey has to pass the keepers to escape. The keepers win, if they enclose the monkey, so it can't move anymore.

boardgame.name: Envyra: Messe Tile
boardgame.description:
Offered for Essen Spiel visitors.

CONTENT: 1 Messe Tile

SETUP & RULES:
After the setup, just add Messe Tile into the Drafting Bag (Tiles Supply). Messe Tile is a restricted tile. During the game, the player is eligible to move their cube onto the Messe Tile as soon as they have captured at least one themed tile (blue or orange or green).

—description from designer

boardgame.name: Salvage
boardgame.description:
Back cover blurb


Salvage is a campaign primer and guide for dealing with Salvage is the vast emptiness of the space between the stars. Designed for use with Cepheus Engine and is compatible with other 2D6 science fiction games.

It includes:

New career of “Salvor” (Professional Salvager).

Explanation of what you can do with a campaign based around a salvage company.

Guide to the laws of space salvage.

Explanation of different types of Salvage.

Equipment and starship modifications specialised for use by Salvors.

Salvage scenario generator.

Break down of how to sell starship components and the prices you can expect.

Break down of the amounts you can expect to receive from owners who’s ships the PCs save.

Warnings about illegal operators and how criminals might try to take over a salvage operation.

boardgame.name: Questionable Quests
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Questionable Quests, a collaborative collection of adventures from an unlikely group of gamers brought together by a shared love of gaming and storytelling. Turn the pages to find abundant adventures for the 5th edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game representing every tier of play, ready to be brought from the page to your table. In these adventures, Villains can be murderous, NPC’s can be a hindrance, and heroes need not always act like a hero. It is not for everyone and we know this. These adventures are...Questionable. To pique the interest of both player and GM, original artwork accompanies each adventure as well as new magic items and monsters! Place these tales in the middle of your existing campaign, as a stand alone adventure, or tie them together with locations or NPC’s.

If you’re just starting out as a Dungeon Master, welcome! We offer support and ideas for every adventure listed as
Optional Variants. These tips and tricks include suggestions of how to modify the adventure to make it easier or harder (maybe impossible) for your party. We even include a Tactics sidebar that contains suggestions for tactics to play the various monsters and villains in each adventure. Monsters are bolded and described in the Bestiary appendix.

boardgame.name: 札束と溶鉱炉 (Satsutaba to Youkouro)
boardgame.description:
札束と溶鉱炉 (Satsutaba to Youkouro) is a 2 player bluffing card game from Japan. The players take two roles; one is building a road and the other is building on the road side. The designer likens the game to Skull. The game title translates as "Bankrolls and Blast Furnaces". The player who most recently fell into a blast furnace gets to go first.

One player arranges five good tiles (bankrolls) and one bad tile (a blast furnace) in a face-down line. The other player turns them over from left to right until they want to stop.

The turning player gets a point for each good tile they turned over, a bonus two points if they stopped just before the bad tile, and no points at all if they turned over the bad tile.

The placing player gets a point for each good tile they placed before the bad tile (i.e. each one that the turning player had an opportunity to take), plus a bonus two points if the turning player turned over the bad tile.

Swap places and do it again, do all of that three times with double points in the last round, whoever has the most points wins.
user summary

¿Lograrán los jugadores detener a Zatael?

boardgame.name: La Olla del Guiverno
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

La olla del guiverno es un volcán del que poco se conoce más allá del nombre, lo que es bastante disuasorio de por sí. Pero, ¿y si lo que hay en su interior hace que merezca la pena el riesgo?

Una aventura autoconclusiva complicada, para personajes de nivel 6 con dos mazmorras y un enemigo final con dos opciones de personaje para adecuar el desafío a tu grupo o cómo hayan llegado los personajes al encuentro.

boardgame.name: しちふくろう (Seven Lucky Owls)
七福廊 (Shichi Fukurou)
boardgame.description:
七福廊 (Shichi Fukurou) is a 2 player card game from Japan. Players are trying to collect seven wise owls to win, or lose getting the five unhappy cats. The publisher says the English title is Seven Lucky Owls. The Japanese title is likely a reference to the Shichi Fukujin (七福神), the Seven Lucky Gods; replacing the word fukurou (梟; owl) with a clever combination of fuku (福; luck, fortune, blessing) + rou (廊; corridor, hall, tower).

Players choose two hand cards face-down and reveal them together. One gets to choose whether the high or low number will win, and the high card of that pair wins. That winner then gets to use the effect on their winning card.

Players build up a tableau of cards, and aim to get the seven different owls to win the game. Otherwise, they try to force the unhappy cats onto the opponent. If a player gets five cats, they lose.
user summary

Publisher's summary:
In this lightweight two-player set collection game, you win by collecting Seven Lucky Owls before the opponent. On the other hand, you lose if five or more Unlucky Cats gather in your hand. Each card with a character also has a number on it. The players take
turns to choose whether a higher- or lower-number card will win.

Following that, they each play one of the two cards from their hand face-down, and then flip to reveal them simultaneously. Compare the numbers on the cards, and the winner can use the effect of the card they played.

Some cards have effects such as reversing the numbers and achieving a come-from-behind victory. Who would manage to outwit their opponent to force Unlucky Cats onto them or collect Seven Lucky Owls?

相手より先に7種類のふくろう「七福廊」を集めましょう！手軽に遊べる２人用セットコレクションゲーム。プレイヤーは相手より先に７種類のふくろう「七福廊」を集めると勝ちとなります。反対に、不幸の猫「黒闇天」を５枚以上集めてしまうと負けてしまいます。
それぞれのキャラクターが描かれたカードには数字も書かれています。毎回片方のプレイヤーが、数字の大きい方が勝つか小さい方が勝つかを選択。お互い２枚の手札から１枚を勝負札として裏向きで場に出します。伏せたカードを同時にオープンし、大小比べに勝ったプレイヤーは、カードに書かれている効果を使うことができます。
カードの中には大小カードを反転する効果や大逆転が狙える効果のついたものもあります。
読み合いを制して「黒闇天」カードをうまく相手に押し付け、「七福廊」を早く集めるのはどちらのプレイヤーでしょうか？

boardgame.name: Horseshoes and Hand Grenades
boardgame.description:
Unconventional tabletop warfare!

Each player is dealt one HQ card, which has its own tactical advantage. Players are then dealt cards, on their turns they draw a card and play a card, attack or defense. Forge and break alliances, wars on all fronts, the table is your warzone!

Each HQ can within stand 20 points of damage before falling, the damage is inflicted by horseshoes, hand grenades, and nukes! There are cards to repair your damage, but remember, nuclear damage is not repairable! Once your HQ hits 20 points of damage, you are out of the game, last HQ standing wins.

—description from designer

boardgame.name: F6F Hellcat
boardgame.description:
26 July 1943, your squadron of Hellcats on the Belleau Wood carrier (CVL-24) have arrived in Pearl Harbor to take the war to the Japanese.

Armed with guns, rockets, and bombs, your job is to take control of the Pacific Islands overrun with Imperial Japanese. Take enough down and you can bring the battle to Mainland Japan and win the war.

Using the Gear Card System, you control your three flights of Hellcats and CVL-24 to shoot down Zeroes and bomb island bases. During that time, you must protect your carrier from Judy’s (Japanese Bombers) and Kamikaze pilots. If your carrier is sunk, it is game over.

You must maintain the right altitude to fire down the Zeroes and high-altitude bombers, while evading their attacks. Dive bombing enemy bases is also no easy task. Flak can bring you down in an instant. All the while, you must keep an eye on your fuel and the threatening sky.

Become an Ace by shooting down Zeroes and earn powerful Upgrades.

Make it through the day and lead the US Navy to victory in the Pacific!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Sunderwald
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the Riven Woods

In the center of the kingdom of Realm, there exists a dark and unsettling forest.

It is known as the Sunderwald.

This is a game about how the woods change us, and how we change the woods. It features a complete, stand-alone game with character creation, enemies, advancement, the whole deal.

It is also a legacy tabletop roleplaying game. During play, you will physically and permanently modify this book. Do not be afraid.

boardgame.name: Tome of Mystical Tattoos
boardgame.description:
An illustrated compendium of magic tattoos

Publisher's blurb:

The design on the tattooist’s arm flickers in the moonlight as she places a steady hand on her companion’s shoulder. Playful wisps of magical energy begin to swirl around them, as her tattoo slides slowly from her skin onto the weary warrior’s—granting him the means to bring down the winged beast looming above!

Within this book, there are close to 200 beautifully illustrated magic tattoos waiting to be applied onto your characters. You will also be introduced to an alternative tattoo system, a brand-new class, and a thrilling adventure to rescue and secure the services of a storied tattooist. Every design comes with its own history, along with fresh and exciting properties that are sure to spice up any campaign.

boardgame.name: Latin American Monsters (5E)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Latin American Monsters brings you incredible creatures from Central and South America and the Caribbean, from ahuizotl to zuvembie! You'll find divine messengers and protectors like the magui and xiuh couatl alongside sinister fiends like the soucouyant and xipe totec the Flayed Lord, living fey like the curupira and encantado alongside deathless terrors like the llorona and tzitzimitl, living engines of destruction like the lusca and chupacabra and unliving constructs like the cuauhxicalli and xolo guardian. Guardians of the wild like the tunche and madremonte stand beside fantastic versions of real-world creatures like the anaconda, giant iguana, black caiman, jaguar, and giant mantis shrimp!

boardgame.name: Sync or Swim
boardgame.description:
Inspired by real life synchronized swimming, Sync or Swim focuses on teamwork, collaboration, and communication.

Each round, teammates plan the perfect routine while taking direction from the team captain. The clock starts and players start trading, placing, and diving for cards to get their performance just right. As your team progresses through each round, the routines become more challenging and throw all sorts of twists your way!

At the end of each round, the free app judges your performance based on your timing and accuracy—You and your friends will discover creative tactics for better strategies and scores each time you play.

—description from the publisher
